summary: The contact owns a 2021 Chevrolet Suburban 1500. The contact stated that while driving at approximately 75 MPH, there was a loud explosion coming from the vehicle. The contact noticed that the sunroof had shattered. The contact mentioned that the sunroof was closed and covered and that glass fragments had not entered the cabin of the vehicle. The vehicle was taken to the dealer where the contact was informed that the fracture was caused by a rock striking the sunroof. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was notified of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 24,000.
